text: And they went out of the prison, and entered into [the house of] Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.

label: Luke
text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:

label: Luke
text: And Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,

label: Luke
text: Opening and alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is Christ.

label: Luke
text: And some of them believed, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.

label: Luke
text: But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.

label: Luke
text: And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;

label: Luke
text: Whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, [one] Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.

label: Luke
text: And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.

label: Luke
text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who coming [thither] went into the synagogue of the Jews.

label: Luke
text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.

label: Luke
text: Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.

label: Luke
text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people.

label: Luke
text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea: but Silas and Timotheus abode there still.

label: Luke
text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed, they departed.

label: Luke
text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.

label: Luke
text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the market daily with them that met with him.

label: Luke
text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, and of the Stoicks, encountered him.

label: Luke
text: And some said, What will this babbler say?

label: Luke
text: other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Jesus, and the resurrection.

label: Luke
text: And they took him, and brought him unto Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, [is]?

label: Luke
text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.

label: Luke
text: (For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.)

label: Luke
text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars’ hill, and said, [Ye] men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.

label: Luke
text: For as I passed by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD.

label: Luke
text: Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you.

label: Luke
text: God that made the world and all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;

label: Luke
text: Neither is worshipped with men’s hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;

label: Luke
text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation;

label: Luke
text: That they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far from every one of us:

label: Luke
text: For in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.

label: Luke
text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and man’s device.

label: Luke
text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent:

label: Luke
text: Because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by [that] man whom he hath ordained; [whereof] he hath given assurance unto all [men], in that he hath raised him from the dead.

label: Luke
text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: and others said, We will hear thee again of this [matter].

label: Luke
text: So Paul departed from among them.

label: Luke
text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the which [was] Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.

label: Luke
text: After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;

label: Luke
text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) and came unto them.

label: Luke
text: And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.

label: Luke
text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.

label: Luke
text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews [that] Jesus [was] Christ.

label: Luke
text: And when they opposed themselves, and blasphemed, he shook [his] raiment, and said unto them, Your blood [be] upon your own heads; I [am] clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.

label: Luke
text: And he departed thence, and entered into a certain [man’s] house, named Justus, [one] that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.

label: Luke
text: And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.

label: Luke
text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:

label: Luke
text: For I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.

label: Luke
text: And he continued [there] a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

label: Luke
text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,

label: Luke
text: Saying, This [fellow] persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.

label: Luke
text: And when Paul was now about to open [his] mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O [ye] Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:

label: Luke
text: But if it be a question of words and names, and [of] your law, look ye [to it]; for I will be no judge of such [matters].

label: Luke
text: And he drave them from the judgment seat.

label: Luke
text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat [him] before the judgment seat.

label: Luke
text: And Gallio cared for none of those things.

label: Luke
text: And Paul [after this] tarried [there] yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila; having shorn [his] head in Cenchrea: for he had a vow.

label: Luke
text: And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

label: Luke
text: When they desired [him] to tarry longer time with them, he consented not;

label: Luke
text: But bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will.

label: Luke
text: And he sailed from Ephesus.

label: Luke
text: And when he had landed at Caesarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.

label: Luke
text: And after he had spent some time [there], he departed, and went over [all] the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.

label: Luke
text: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man, [and] mighty in the scriptures, came to Ephesus.

label: Luke
text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in the spirit, he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John.

label: Luke
text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue: whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard, they took him unto [them], and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.

label: Luke
text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:

label: Luke
text: For he mightily convinced the Jews, [and that] publickly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples,

label: Luke
text: He said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed?

label: Luke
text: And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost.

label: Luke
text: And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized?

label: Luke
text: And they said, Unto John’s baptism.

label: Luke
text: Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.

label: Luke
text: When they heard [this], they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And when Paul had laid [his] hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.

label: Luke
text: And all the men were about twelve.

label: Luke
text: And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.

label: Luke
text: But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.

label: Luke
text: And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.

label: Luke
text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:

label: Luke
text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.

label: Luke
text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.

label: Luke
text: And there were seven sons of [one] Sceva, a Jew, [and] chief of the priests, which did so.

label: Luke
text: And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?

label: Luke
text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

label: Luke
text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.

label: Luke
text: And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.

label: Luke
text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before all [men]: and they counted the price of them, and found [it] fifty thousand [pieces] of silver.

label: Luke
text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.

label: Luke
text: After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.

label: Luke
text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timotheus and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.

label: Luke
text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.

label: Luke
text: For a certain [man] named Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;

label: Luke
text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.

label: Luke
text: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:

label: Luke
text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.

label: Luke
text: And when they heard [these sayings], they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great [is] Diana of the Ephesians.

label: Luke
text: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.

label: Luke
text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.

label: Luke
text: And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring [him] that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.

label: Luke
text: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.

label: Luke
text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward.

label: Luke
text: And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.

label: Luke
text: But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great [is] Diana of the Ephesians.

label: Luke
text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, [Ye] men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the [image] which fell down from Jupiter?

label: Luke
text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.

label: Luke
text: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.

label: Luke
text: Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.

label: Luke
text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.

label: Luke
text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day’s uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.

label: Luke
text: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

label: Luke
text: And after the uproar was ceased, Paul called unto [him] the disciples, and embraced [them], and departed for to go into Macedonia.

label: Luke
text: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,

label: Luke
text: And [there] abode three months.

label: Luke
text: And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.

label: Luke
text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

label: Luke
text: These going before tarried for us at Troas.

label: Luke
text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we abode seven days.

label: Luke
text: And upon the first [day] of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight.

label: Luke
text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together.

label: Luke
text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.

label: Luke
text: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing [him] said, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.

label: Luke
text: When he therefore was come up again, and had broken bread, and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.

label: Luke
text: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.

label: Luke
text: And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.

label: Luke
text: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.

label: Luke
text: And we sailed thence, and came the next [day] over against Chios; and the next [day] we arrived at Samos, and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next [day] we came to Miletus.

label: Luke
text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia: for he hasted, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.

label: Luke
text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.

label: Luke
text: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, after what manner I have been with you at all seasons,

label: Luke
text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations, which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews:

label: Luke
text: [And] how I kept back nothing that was profitable [unto you], but have shewed you, and have taught you publickly, and from house to house,

label: Luke
text: Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Luke
text: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:

label: Luke
text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.

label: Luke
text: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.

label: Luke
text: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.

label: Luke
text: Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I [am] pure from the blood of all [men].

label: Luke
text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.

label: Luke
text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.

label: Luke
text: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

label: Luke
text: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.

label: Luke
text: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.

label: Luke
text: And now, brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.

label: Luke
text: I have coveted no man’s silver, or gold, or apparel.

label: Luke
text: Yea, ye yourselves know, that these hands have ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.

label: Luke
text: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.

label: Luke
text: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.

label: Luke
text: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul’s neck, and kissed him,

label: Luke
text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more.

label: Luke
text: And they accompanied him unto the ship.

label: Luke
text: And it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had launched, we came with a straight course unto Coos, and the [day] following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:

label: Luke
text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.

label: Luke
text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed into Syria, and landed at Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.

label: Luke
text: And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: And when we had accomplished those days, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, till [we were] out of the city: and we kneeled down on the shore, and prayed.

label: Luke
text: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.

label: Luke
text: And when we had finished [our] course from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, and saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.

label: Luke
text: And the next [day] we that were of Paul’s company departed, and came unto Caesarea: and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, which was [one] of the seven; and abode with him.

label: Luke
text: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.

label: Luke
text: And as we tarried [there] many days, there came down from Judaea a certain prophet, named Agabus.

label: Luke
text: And when he was come unto us, he took Paul’s girdle, and bound his own hands and feet, and said, Thus saith the Holy Ghost, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver [him] into the hands of the Gentiles.

label: Luke
text: And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: Then Paul answered, What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart?

label: Luke
text: for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.

label: Luke
text: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.

label: Luke
text: And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.

label: Luke
text: There went with us also [certain] of the disciples of Caesarea, and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.

label: Luke
text: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.

label: Luke
text: And the [day] following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.

label: Luke
text: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.

label: Luke
text: And when they heard [it], they glorified the Lord, and said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are which believe; and they are all zealous of the law:

label: Luke
text: And they are informed of thee, that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise [their] children, neither to walk after the customs.

label: Luke
text: What is it therefore?

label: Luke
text: the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.

label: Luke
text: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;

label: Luke
text: Them take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges with them, that they may shave [their] heads: and all may know that those things, whereof they were informed concerning thee, are nothing; but [that] thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest the law.

label: Luke
text: As touching the Gentiles which believe, we have written [and] concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from [things] offered to idols, and from blood, and from strangled, and from fornication.

label: Luke
text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple, to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until that an offering should be offered for every one of them.

label: Luke
text: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews which were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people, and laid hands on him,

label: Luke
text: Crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man, that teacheth all [men] every where against the people, and the law, and this place: and further brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.

label: Luke
text: (For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)

label: Luke
text: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together: and they took Paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the doors were shut.

label: Luke
text: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

label: Luke
text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down unto them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left beating of Paul.

label: Luke
text: Then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commanded [him] to be bound with two chains; and demanded who he was, and what he had done.

label: Luke
text: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude: and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.

label: Luke
text: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.

label: Luke
text: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.

label: Luke
text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, May I speak unto thee?

label: Luke
text: Who said, Canst thou speak Greek?

label: Luke
text: Art not thou that Egyptian, which before these days madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers?

label: Luke
text: But Paul said, I am a man [which am] a Jew of Tarsus, [a city] in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and, I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.

label: Luke
text: And when he had given him licence, Paul stood on the stairs, and beckoned with the hand unto the people.

label: Luke
text: And when there was made a great silence, he spake unto [them] in the Hebrew tongue, saying,

label: Luke
text: Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defence [which I make] now unto you.

label: Luke
text: (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith,)

label: Luke
text: I am verily a man [which am] a Jew, born in Tarsus, [a city] in Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, [and] taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.

label: Luke
text: And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

label: Luke
text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to Damascus, to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem, for to be punished.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Zabulon [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Joseph [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: Of the tribe of Benjamin [were] sealed twelve thousand.

label: John
text: After this I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues, stood before the throne, and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands;

label: John
text: And cried with a loud voice, saying, Salvation to our God which sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb.

label: John
text: And all the angels stood round about the throne, and [about] the elders and the four beasts, and fell before the throne on their faces, and worshipped God,

label: John
text: Saying, Amen: Blessing, and glory, and wisdom, and thanksgiving, and honour, and power, and might, [be] unto our God for ever and ever.

label: John
text: Amen.

label: John
text: And one of the elders answered, saying unto me, What are these which are arrayed in white robes?

label: John
text: and whence came they?

label: John
text: And I said unto him, Sir, thou knowest.

label: John
text: And he said to me, These are they which came out of great tribulation, and have washed their robes, and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

label: John
text: Therefore are they before the throne of God, and serve him day and night in his temple: and he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell among them.

label: John
text: They shall hunger no more, neither thirst any more; neither shall the sun light on them, nor any heat.

label: John
text: For the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and shall lead them unto living fountains of waters: and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes.

label: John
text: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven about the space of half an hour.

label: John
text: And I saw the seven angels which stood before God; and to them were given seven trumpets.

label: John
text: And another angel came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given unto him much incense, that he should offer [it] with the prayers of all saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne.

label: John
text: And the smoke of the incense, [which came] with the prayers of the saints, ascended up before God out of the angel’s hand.

label: John
text: And the angel took the censer, and filled it with fire of the altar, and cast [it] into the earth: and there were voices, and thunderings, and lightnings, and an earthquake.

label: John
text: And the seven angels which had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.

label: John
text: The first angel sounded, and there followed hail and fire mingled with blood, and they were cast upon the earth: and the third part of trees was burnt up, and all green grass was burnt up.

label: John
text: And the second angel sounded, and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea became blood;

label: John
text: And the third part of the creatures which were in the sea, and had life, died; and the third part of the ships were destroyed.

label: John
text: And the third angel sounded, and there fell a great star from heaven, burning as it were a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers, and upon the fountains of waters;

label: John
text: And the name of the star is called Wormwood: and the third part of the waters became wormwood; and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.

label: John
text: And the fourth angel sounded, and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars; so as the third part of them was darkened, and the day shone not for a third part of it, and the night likewise.

label: John
text: And I beheld, and heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice, Woe, woe, woe, to the inhabiters of the earth by reason of the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels, which are yet to sound!

label: John
text: And the fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth: and to him was given the key of the bottomless pit.

label: John
text: And he opened the bottomless pit; and there arose a smoke out of the pit, as the smoke of a great furnace; and the sun and the air were darkened by reason of the smoke of the pit.

label: John
text: And there came out of the smoke locusts upon the earth: and unto them was given power, as the scorpions of the earth have power.

label: John
text: And it was commanded them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, neither any green thing, neither any tree; but only those men which have not the seal of God in their foreheads.

label: John
text: And to them it was given that they should not kill them, but that they should be tormented five months: and their torment [was] as the torment of a scorpion, when he striketh a man.

label: John
text: And in those days shall men seek death, and shall not find it; and shall desire to die, and death shall flee from them.

label: John
text: And the shapes of the locusts [were] like unto horses prepared unto battle; and on their heads [were] as it were crowns like gold, and their faces [were] as the faces of men.

label: John
text: And they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as [the teeth] of lions.

label: John
text: And they had breastplates, as it were breastplates of iron; and the sound of their wings [was] as the sound of chariots of many horses running to battle.

label: John
text: And they had tails like unto scorpions, and there were stings in their tails: and their power [was] to hurt men five months.

label: John
text: And they had a king over them, [which is] the angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in the Hebrew tongue [is] Abaddon, but in the Greek tongue hath [his] name Apollyon.

label: John
text: One woe is past; [and], behold, there come two woes more hereafter.

label: John
text: And the sixth angel sounded, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God,

label: John
text: Saying to the sixth angel which had the trumpet, Loose the four angels which are bound in the great river Euphrates.

label: John
text: And the four angels were loosed, which were prepared for an hour, and a day, and a month, and a year, for to slay the third part of men.

label: John
text: And the number of the army of the horsemen [were] two hundred thousand thousand: and I heard the number of them.

label: John
text: And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and them that sat on them, having breastplates of fire, and of jacinth, and brimstone: and the heads of the horses [were] as the heads of lions; and out of their mouths issued fire and smoke and brimstone.

label: John
text: By these three was the third part of men killed, by the fire, and by the smoke, and by the brimstone, which issued out of their mouths.

label: John
text: For their power is in their mouth, and in their tails: for their tails [were] like unto serpents, and had heads, and with them they do hurt.

label: John
text: And the rest of the men which were not killed by these plagues yet repented not of the works of their hands, that they should not worship devils, and idols of gold, and silver, and brass, and stone, and of wood: which neither can see, nor hear, nor walk:

label: John
text: Neither repented they of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their fornication, nor of their thefts.

label: John
text: And I saw another mighty angel come down from heaven, clothed with a cloud: and a rainbow [was] upon his head, and his face [was] as it were the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire:

label: John
text: And he had in his hand a little book open: and he set his right foot upon the sea, and [his] left [foot] on the earth,

label: John
text: And cried with a loud voice, as [when] a lion roareth: and when he had cried, seven thunders uttered their voices.

label: John
text: And when the seven thunders had uttered their voices, I was about to write: and I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Seal up those things which the seven thunders uttered, and write them not.

label: John
text: And the angel which I saw stand upon the sea and upon the earth lifted up his hand to heaven,

label: John
text: And sware by him that liveth for ever and ever, who created heaven, and the things that therein are, and the earth, and the things that therein are, and the sea, and the things which are therein, that there should be time no longer:

label: John
text: But in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he shall begin to sound, the mystery of God should be finished, as he hath declared to his servants the prophets.

label: John
text: And the voice which I heard from heaven spake unto me again, and said, Go [and] take the little book which is open in the hand of the angel which standeth upon the sea and upon the earth.

label: John
text: And I went unto the angel, and said unto him, Give me the little book.

label: John
text: And he said unto me, Take [it], and eat it up; and it shall make thy belly bitter, but it shall be in thy mouth sweet as honey.

label: John
text: And I took the little book out of the angel’s hand, and ate it up; and it was in my mouth sweet as honey: and as soon as I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.

label: John
text: And he said unto me, Thou must prophesy again before many peoples, and nations, and tongues, and kings.

label: John
text: And there was given me a reed like unto a rod: and the angel stood, saying, Rise, and measure the temple of God, and the altar, and them that worship therein.

label: John
text: But the court which is without the temple leave out, and measure it not; for it is given unto the Gentiles: and the holy city shall they tread under foot forty [and] two months.

label: John
text: And I will give [power] unto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred [and] threescore days, clothed in sackcloth.

label: John
text: These are the two olive trees, and the two candlesticks standing before the God of the earth.

label: John
text: And if any man will hurt them, fire proceedeth out of their mouth, and devoureth their enemies: and if any man will hurt them, he must in this manner be killed.

label: John
text: These have power to shut heaven, that it rain not in the days of their prophecy: and have power over waters to turn them to blood, and to smite the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.

label: John
text: And when they shall have finished their testimony, the beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them, and shall overcome them, and kill them.

label: John
text: And their dead bodies [shall lie] in the street of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also our Lord was crucified.

label: John
text: And they of the people and kindreds and tongues and nations shall see their dead bodies three days and an half, and shall not suffer their dead bodies to be put in graves.

label: John
text: And they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoice over them, and make merry, and shall send gifts one to another; because these two prophets tormented them that dwelt on the earth.

label: John
text: And after three days and an half the Spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon them which saw them.

label: John
text: And they heard a great voice from heaven saying unto them, Come up hither.

label: John
text: And they ascended up to heaven in a cloud; and their enemies beheld them.

label: John
text: And the same hour was there a great earthquake, and the tenth part of the city fell, and in the earthquake were slain of men seven thousand: and the remnant were affrighted, and gave glory to the God of heaven.

label: John
text: The second woe is past; [and], behold, the third woe cometh quickly.

label: John
text: And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying, The kingdoms of this world are become [the kingdoms] of our Lord, and of his Christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever.

label: John
text: And the four and twenty elders, which sat before God on their seats, fell upon their faces, and worshipped God,

label: John
text: Saying, We give thee thanks, O Lord God Almighty, which art, and wast, and art to come; because thou hast taken to thee thy great power, and hast reigned.

label: John
text: And the nations were angry, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and them that fear thy name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth.

label: John
text: And the temple of God was opened in heaven, and there was seen in his temple the ark of his testament: and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunderings, and an earthquake, and great hail.

label: John
text: And there appeared a great wonder in heaven; a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars:

label: John
text: And she being with child cried, travailing in birth, and pained to be delivered.

label: John
text: And there appeared another wonder in heaven; and behold a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and seven crowns upon his heads.

label: John
text: And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood before the woman which was ready to be delivered, for to devour her child as soon as it was born.

label: John
text: And she brought forth a man child, who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron: and her child was caught up unto God, and [to] his throne.

label: John
text: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred [and] threescore days.

label: John
text: And there was war in heaven: Michael and his angels fought against the dragon; and the dragon fought and his angels,

label: John
text: And prevailed not; neither was their place found any more in heaven.

label: John
text: And the great dragon was cast out, that old serpent, called the Devil, and Satan, which deceiveth the whole world: he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.

label: John
text: And I heard a loud voice saying in heaven, Now is come salvation, and strength, and the kingdom of our God, and the power of his Christ: for the accuser of our brethren is cast down, which accused them before our God day and night.

label: John
text: And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony; and they loved not their lives unto the death.

label: John
text: Therefore rejoice, [ye] heavens, and ye that dwell in them.

label: John
text: Woe to the inhabiters of the earth and of the sea!

label: John
text: for the devil is come down unto you, having great wrath, because he knoweth that he hath but a short time.

label: John
text: And when the dragon saw that he was cast unto the earth, he persecuted the woman which brought forth the man [child].

label: John
text: And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness, into her place, where she is nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.

label: John
text: And the serpent cast out of his mouth water as a flood after the woman, that he might cause her to be carried away of the flood.

label: John
text: And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth.

label: John
text: And the dragon was wroth with the woman, and went to make war with the remnant of her seed, which keep the commandments of God, and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.

label: John
text: And I stood upon the sand of the sea, and saw a beast rise up out of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns, and upon his horns ten crowns, and upon his heads the name of blasphemy.

label: John
text: And the beast which I saw was like unto a leopard, and his feet were as [the feet] of a bear, and his mouth as the mouth of a lion: and the dragon gave him his power, and his seat, and great authority.

label: John
text: And I saw one of his heads as it were wounded to death; and his deadly wound was healed: and all the world wondered after the beast.

label: John
text: And they worshipped the dragon which gave power unto the beast: and they worshipped the beast, saying, Who [is] like unto the beast?

label: John
text: who is able to make war with him?

label: John
text: And there was given unto him a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies; and power was given unto him to continue forty [and] two months.

label: John
text: And he opened his mouth in blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name, and his tabernacle, and them that dwell in heaven.

label: John
text: And it was given unto him to make war with the saints, and to overcome them: and power was given him over all kindreds, and tongues, and nations.

label: John
text: And all that dwell upon the earth shall worship him, whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world.

label: John
text: If any man have an ear, let him hear.

label: John
text: He that leadeth into captivity shall go into captivity: he that killeth with the sword must be killed with the sword.

label: John
text: Here is the patience and the faith of the saints.

label: John
text: And I beheld another beast coming up out of the earth; and he had two horns like a lamb, and he spake as a dragon.

label: John
text: And he exerciseth all the power of the first beast before him, and causeth the earth and them which dwell therein to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed.

label: John
text: And he doeth great wonders, so that he maketh fire come down from heaven on the earth in the sight of men,

label: John
text: And deceiveth them that dwell on the earth by [the means of] those miracles which he had power to do in the sight of the beast; saying to them that dwell on the earth, that they should make an image to the beast, which had the wound by a sword, and did live.

label: John
text: And he had power to give life unto the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak, and cause that as many as would not worship the image of the beast should be killed.

label: John
text: And he causeth all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and bond, to receive a mark in their right hand, or in their foreheads:

label: John
text: And that no man might buy or sell, save he that had the mark, or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.

label: John
text: Here is wisdom.

label: John
text: Let him that hath understanding count the number of the beast: for it is the number of a man; and his number [is] Six hundred threescore [and] six.

label: John
text: And I looked, and, lo, a Lamb stood on the mount Sion, and with him an hundred forty [and] four thousand, having his Father’s name written in their foreheads.

label: John
text: And I heard a voice from heaven, as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of a great thunder: and I heard the voice of harpers harping with their harps:

label: John
text: And they sung as it were a new song before the throne, and before the four beasts, and the elders: and no man could learn that song but the hundred [and] forty [and] four thousand, which were redeemed from the earth.

label: John
text: These are they which were not defiled with women; for they are virgins.

label: John
text: These are they which follow the Lamb whithersoever he goeth.

label: John
text: These were redeemed from among men, [being] the firstfruits unto God and to the Lamb.

label: John
text: And in their mouth was found no guile: for they are without fault before the throne of God.

label: John
text: And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people,

label: John
text: Saying with a loud voice, Fear God, and give glory to him; for the hour of his judgment is come: and worship him that made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.

label: John
text: And there followed another angel, saying, Babylon is fallen, is fallen, that great city, because she made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.

label: John
text: And the third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, If any man worship the beast and his image, and receive [his] mark in his forehead, or in his hand,

label: John
text: The same shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out without mixture into the cup of his indignation; and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:

label: John
text: And the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever: and they have no rest day nor night, who worship the beast and his image, and whosoever receiveth the mark of his name.

label: John
text: Here is the patience of the saints: here [are] they that keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.

label: John
text: And I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Write, Blessed [are] the dead which die in the Lord from henceforth: Yea, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labours; and their works do follow them.

label: John
text: And I looked, and behold a white cloud, and upon the cloud [one] sat like unto the Son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.

label: John
text: And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him that sat on the cloud, Thrust in thy sickle, and reap: for the time is come for thee to reap; for the harvest of the earth is ripe.

label: John
text: And he that sat on the cloud thrust in his sickle on the earth; and the earth was reaped.

label: John
text: And another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, he also having a sharp sickle.

label: John
text: And another angel came out from the altar, which had power over fire; and cried with a loud cry to him that had the sharp sickle, saying, Thrust in thy sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth; for her grapes are fully ripe.

label: John
text: And the angel thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and cast [it] into the great winepress of the wrath of God.

label: John
text: And the winepress was trodden without the city, and blood came out of the winepress, even unto the horse bridles, by the space of a thousand [and] six hundred furlongs.

label: John
text: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and marvellous, seven angels having the seven last plagues; for in them is filled up the wrath of God.

label: John
text: And I saw as it were a sea of glass mingled with fire: and them that had gotten the victory over the beast, and over his image, and over his mark, [and] over the number of his name, stand on the sea of glass, having the harps of God.

label: John
text: And they sing the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, Great and marvellous [are] thy works, Lord God Almighty; just and true [are] thy ways, thou King of saints.

label: John
text: Who shall not fear thee, O Lord, and glorify thy name?

label: John
text: for [thou] only [art] holy: for all nations shall come and worship before thee; for thy judgments are made manifest.

label: John
text: And after that I looked, and, behold, the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened:

label: John
text: And the seven angels came out of the temple, having the seven plagues, clothed in pure and white linen, and having their breasts girded with golden girdles.

label: John
text: And one of the four beasts gave unto the seven angels seven golden vials full of the wrath of God, who liveth for ever and ever.

label: John
text: And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God, and from his power; and no man was able to enter into the temple, till the seven plagues of the seven angels were fulfilled.

label: John
text: And I heard a great voice out of the temple saying to the seven angels, Go your ways, and pour out the vials of the wrath of God upon the earth.

label: John
text: And the first went, and poured out his vial upon the earth; and there fell a noisome and grievous sore upon the men which had the mark of the beast, and [upon] them which worshipped his image.

label: John
text: And the second angel poured out his vial upon the sea; and it became as the blood of a dead [man]: and every living soul died in the sea.

label: John
text: And the third angel poured out his vial upon the rivers and fountains of waters; and they became blood.

label: John
text: And I heard the angel of the waters say, Thou art righteous, O Lord, which art, and wast, and shalt be, because thou hast judged thus.

label: John
text: For they have shed the blood of saints and prophets, and thou hast given them blood to drink; for they are worthy.

label: John
text: And I heard another out of the altar say, Even so, Lord God Almighty, true and righteous [are] thy judgments.

label: John
text: And the fourth angel poured out his vial upon the sun; and power was given unto him to scorch men with fire.

label: John
text: And men were scorched with great heat, and blasphemed the name of God, which hath power over these plagues: and they repented not to give him glory.

label: John
text: And the fifth angel poured out his vial upon the seat of the beast; and his kingdom was full of darkness; and they gnawed their tongues for pain,

label: Paul
text: Knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law: for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.

label: Paul
text: But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, [is] therefore Christ the minister of sin?

label: Paul
text: God forbid.

label: Paul
text: For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.

label: Paul
text: For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.

label: Paul
text: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.

label: Paul
text: I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousness [come] by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.

label: Paul
text: O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?

label: Paul
text: This only would I learn of you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

label: Paul
text: Are ye so foolish?

label: Paul
text: having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect by the flesh?

label: Paul
text: Have ye suffered so many things in vain?

label: Paul
text: if [it be] yet in vain.

label: Paul
text: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you, [doeth he it] by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?

label: Paul
text: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.

label: Paul
text: Know ye therefore that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.

label: Paul
text: And the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith, preached before the gospel unto Abraham, [saying], In thee shall all nations be blessed.

label: Paul
text: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.

label: Paul
text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse: for it is written, Cursed [is] every one that continueth not in all things which are written in the book of the law to do them.

label: Paul
text: But that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God, [it is] evident: for, The just shall live by faith.

label: Paul
text: And the law is not of faith: but, The man that doeth them shall live in them.

label: Paul
text: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursed [is] every one that hangeth on a tree:

label: Paul
text: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, I speak after the manner of men; Though [it be] but a man’s covenant, yet [if it be] confirmed, no man disannulleth, or addeth thereto.

label: Paul
text: Now to Abraham and his seed were the promises made.

label: Paul
text: He saith not, And to seeds, as of many; but as of one, And to thy seed, which is Christ.

label: Paul
text: And this I say, [that] the covenant, that was confirmed before of God in Christ, the law, which was four hundred and thirty years after, cannot disannul, that it should make the promise of none effect.

label: Paul
text: For if the inheritance [be] of the law, [it is] no more of promise: but God gave [it] to Abraham by promise.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore then [serveth] the law?

label: Paul
text: It was added because of transgressions, till the seed should come to whom the promise was made; [and it was] ordained by angels in the hand of a mediator.

label: Paul
text: Now a mediator is not [a mediator] of one, but God is one.

label: Paul
text: [Is] the law then against the promises of God?

label: Paul
text: God forbid: for if there had been a law given which could have given life, verily righteousness should have been by the law.

label: Paul
text: But the scripture hath concluded all under sin, that the promise by faith of Jesus Christ might be given to them that believe.

label: Paul
text: But before faith came, we were kept under the law, shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore the law was our schoolmaster [to bring us] unto Christ, that we might be justified by faith.

label: Paul
text: But after that faith is come, we are no longer under a schoolmaster.

label: Paul
text: For ye are all the children of God by faith in Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.

label: Paul
text: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female: for ye are all one in Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: And if ye [be] Christ’s, then are ye Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.

label: Paul
text: Now I say, [That] the heir, as long as he is a child, differeth nothing from a servant, though he be lord of all;

label: Paul
text: But is under tutors and governors until the time appointed of the father.

label: Paul
text: Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world:

label: Paul
text: But when the fulness of the time was come, God sent forth his Son, made of a woman, made under the law,

label: Paul
text: To redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.

label: Paul
text: And because ye are sons, God hath sent forth the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, Abba, Father.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore thou art no more a servant, but a son; and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.

label: Paul
text: Howbeit then, when ye knew not God, ye did service unto them which by nature are no gods.

label: Paul
text: But now, after that ye have known God, or rather are known of God, how turn ye again to the weak and beggarly elements, whereunto ye desire again to be in bondage?

label: Paul
text: Ye observe days, and months, and times, and years.

label: Paul
text: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, I beseech you, be as I [am]; for I [am] as ye [are]: ye have not injured me at all.

label: Paul
text: Ye know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel unto you at the first.

label: Paul
text: And my temptation which was in my flesh ye despised not, nor rejected; but received me as an angel of God, [even] as Christ Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Where is then the blessedness ye spake of?

label: Paul
text: for I bear you record, that, if [it had been] possible, ye would have plucked out your own eyes, and have given them to me.

label: Paul
text: Am I therefore become your enemy, because I tell you the truth?

label: Paul
text: They zealously affect you, [but] not well; yea, they would exclude you, that ye might affect them.

label: Paul
text: But [it is] good to be zealously affected always in [a] good [thing], and not only when I am present with you.

label: Paul
text: My little children, of whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you,

label: Paul
text: I desire to be present with you now, and to change my voice; for I stand in doubt of you.

label: Paul
text: Tell me, ye that desire to be under the law, do ye not hear the law?

label: Paul
text: For it is written, that Abraham had two sons, the one by a bondmaid, the other by a freewoman.

label: Paul
text: But he [who was] of the bondwoman was born after the flesh; but he of the freewoman [was] by promise.

label: Paul
text: Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.

label: Paul
text: For this Agar is mount Sinai in Arabia, and answereth to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children.

label: Paul
text: But Jerusalem which is above is free, which is the mother of us all.

label: Paul
text: For it is written, Rejoice, [thou] barren that bearest not; break forth and cry, thou that travailest not: for the desolate hath many more children than she which hath an husband.

label: Paul
text: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are the children of promise.

label: Paul
text: But as then he that was born after the flesh persecuted him [that was born] after the Spirit, even so [it is] now.

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless what saith the scripture?

label: Paul
text: Cast out the bondwoman and her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.

label: Paul
text: So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman, but of the free.

label: Paul
text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free, and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.

label: Paul
text: Behold, I Paul say unto you, that if ye be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

label: Paul
text: For I testify again to every man that is circumcised, that he is a debtor to do the whole law.

label: Paul
text: Christ is become of no effect unto you, whosoever of you are justified by the law; ye are fallen from grace.

label: Paul
text: For we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness by faith.

label: Paul
text: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision; but faith which worketh by love.

label: Paul
text: Ye did run well; who did hinder you that ye should not obey the truth?

label: Paul
text: This persuasion [cometh] not of him that calleth you.

label: Paul
text: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.

label: Paul
text: I have confidence in you through the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.

label: Paul
text: And I, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why do I yet suffer persecution?

label: Paul
text: then is the offence of the cross ceased.

label: Paul
text: I would they were even cut off which trouble you.

label: Paul
text: For, brethren, ye have been called unto liberty; only [use] not liberty for an occasion to the flesh, but by love serve one another.

label: Paul
text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word, [even] in this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

label: Paul
text: But if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye be not consumed one of another.

label: Paul
text: [This] I say then, Walk in the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfil the lust of the flesh.

label: Paul
text: For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these are contrary the one to the other: so that ye cannot do the things that ye would.

label: Paul
text: But if ye be led of the Spirit, ye are not under the law.

label: Paul
text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are [these]; Adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness,

label: Paul
text: Idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, variance, emulations, wrath, strife, seditions, heresies,

label: Paul
text: Envyings, murders, drunkenness, revellings, and such like: of the which I tell you before, as I have also told [you] in time past, that they which do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.

label: Paul
text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,

label: Paul
text: Meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.

label: Paul
text: And they that are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with the affections and lusts.

label: Paul
text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.

label: Paul
text: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.

label: Paul
text: Bear ye one another’s burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.

label: Paul
text: For if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.

label: Paul
text: But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.

label: Paul
text: For every man shall bear his own burden.

label: Paul
text: Let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.

label: Paul
text: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.

label: Paul
text: For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.

label: Paul
text: And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.

label: Paul
text: As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all [men], especially unto them who are of the household of faith.

label: Paul
text: Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand.

label: Paul
text: As many as desire to make a fair shew in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised; only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.

label: Paul
text: For neither they themselves who are circumcised keep the law; but desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.

label: Paul
text: But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world.

label: Paul
text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.

label: Paul
text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace [be] on them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

label: Paul
text: From henceforth let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.

label: Paul
text: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit.

label: Paul
text: Amen.

label: Paul
text: Paul and Timotheus, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:

label: Paul
text: Grace [be] unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,

label: Paul
text: Always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy,

label: Paul
text: For your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now;

label: Paul
text: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform [it] until the day of Jesus Christ:

label: Paul
text: Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are partakers of my grace.

label: Paul
text: For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

label: Paul
text: And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and [in] all judgment;

label: Paul
text: That ye may approve things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ;

label: Paul
text: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.

label: Paul
text: But I would ye should understand, brethren, that the things [which happened] unto me have fallen out rather unto the furtherance of the gospel;

label: Paul
text: So that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all other [places];

label: Paul
text: And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.

label: Paul
text: Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:

label: Paul
text: The one preach Christ of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds:

label: Paul
text: But the other of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel.

label: Paul
text: What then?

label: Paul
text: notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretence, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.

label: Paul
text: For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

label: Paul
text: According to my earnest expectation and [my] hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but [that] with all boldness, as always, [so] now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether [it be] by life, or by death.

label: Paul
text: For to me to live [is] Christ, and to die [is] gain.

label: Paul
text: But if I live in the flesh, this [is] the fruit of my labour: yet what I shall choose I wot not.

label: Paul
text: For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better:

label: Paul
text: Nevertheless to abide in the flesh [is] more needful for you.

label: Paul
text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;

label: Paul
text: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

label: Paul
text: Only let your conversation be as it becometh the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;

label: Paul
text: And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.

label: Paul
text: For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;

label: Paul
text: Having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear [to be] in me.

label: Paul
text: If [there be] therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,

label: Paul
text: Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, [being] of one accord, of one mind.

label: Paul
text: [Let] nothing [be done] through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

label: Paul
text: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

label: Paul
text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

label: Paul
text: Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:

label: Paul
text: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

label: Paul
text: And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:

label: Paul
text: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of [things] in heaven, and [things] in earth, and [things] under the earth;

label: Paul
text: And [that] every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ [is] Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

label: Paul
text: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

label: Paul
text: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of [his] good pleasure.

label: Paul
text: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:

label: Paul
text: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;

label: Paul
text: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.

label: Paul
text: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.

label: Paul
text: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.

label: Paul
text: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

label: Paul
text: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.

label: Paul
text: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ’s.

label: Paul
text: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.

label: Paul
text: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.

label: Peter
text: If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy [are ye]; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: on their part he is evil spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.

label: Peter
text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, or [as] a thief, or [as] an evildoer, or as a busybody in other men’s matters.

label: Peter
text: Yet if [any man suffer] as a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God on this behalf.

label: Peter
text: For the time [is come] that judgment must begin at the house of God: and if [it] first [begin] at us, what shall the end [be] of them that obey not the gospel of God?

label: Peter
text: And if the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?

label: Peter
text: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their souls [to him] in well doing, as unto a faithful Creator.

label: Peter
text: The elders which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:

label: Peter
text: Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversight [thereof], not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind;

label: Peter
text: Neither as being lords over [God’s] heritage, but being ensamples to the flock.

label: Peter
text: And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.

label: Peter
text: Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder.

label: Peter
text: Yea, all [of you] be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

label: James
text: Your riches are corrupted, and your garments are motheaten.

label: James
text: Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire.

label: James
text: Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.

label: James
text: Behold, the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.

label: James
text: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.

label: James
text: Ye have condemned [and] killed the just; [and] he doth not resist you.

label: James
text: Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord.

label: James
text: Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.

label: James
text: Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.

label: James
text: Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.

label: James
text: Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.

label: James
text: Behold, we count them happy which endure.

label: James
text: Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.

label: Jude
text: Keep yourselves in the love of God, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life.

label: Jude
text: And of some have compassion, making a difference:

label: Jude
text: And others save with fear, pulling [them] out of the fire; hating even the garment spotted by the flesh.
